business.headline: Switzerland cancels 'most favoured nation' status to India over Nestle ruling The Swiss government has suspended the MFN clause in its tax treaty with India, potentially leading to higher taxes on Indian companies operating in Switzerland. This move follows a Supreme Court ruling affecting the interpretation of the MFN clause.
Bill Gates to go bankrupt? Tesla CEO Elon Musk explains howElon Musk claims Bill Gates could face bankruptcy over his alleged Tesla short position if the company dominates globally.
Uncovered: Network of suspected scam sites lure 'dabba' tradersIndia Today uncovers a web of suspected scammer sites posing as platforms for the "dabba" stock trade, an illegal practice.

Oh Gary, how could you: Elon Musk mocks US body amid Twitter stock probeA letter from Elon Musk's attorney, Alex Spiro, addressed to outgoing US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) Chair Gary Gensler, alleged that the agency gave Musk a 48-hour ultimatum.
Sensex, Nifty rebound to end higher; FMCG and IT stocks lead recoveryThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 843.16 points to close at 82,133.12, while the NSE Nifty50 added 219.60 points to end at 24,768.30.
EPFO key amendments: Now faster claims and more interest benefits for membersEPFO's amendments focus on reducing delays, quicker claims, and better interest benefits for its members.

Sensex gains 700 points: 3 reasons behind stock market volatility todayStock market rebound: The S&P BSE Sensex was up 730.39 points to 82,020.35, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 192.70 points to 24,741.40, as of 3 PM.

Mobikwik IPO listing: Does GMP suggest strong market debut amid heavy demand?Mobikwik IPO has seen very strong demand among investors and was fully booked within the first hour of opening for subscription.
Sensex back in green: Airtel, HUL, and IT stocks lead market rebound As of 12:52 PM, Sensex was up by 111.46 points to 81,401.42, while Nifty50 gained 12.75 points to 24,561.45.

Vishal Mega Mart IPO last day: Check gmp, subscription. Shoud you subscribe?Vishal Mega Mart IPO has set a price range of Rs 74 to Rs 78 per share. Retail investors need to purchase a minimum of 190 shares in a single lot, requiring an initial investment of Rs 14,820.
Azim Premji, Ranjan Pai to buy a minority stake in Akasa Air: ReportAzim Premji and Ranjan Pai family offices acquired a minority stake in Akasa Air as part of a $130-140 million fundraising round.
Explained: Why a credit score over 800 mattersHigh credit scores boost financial health by offering cheaper loans, and better insurance discounts, amongst others.

Gold, silver price today, December 13, 2024: Precious metals witness dip on MCXGold Price Today December 13, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the lower side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Friday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

Sensex falls 1,000 points: Key factors behind stock market weaknessStock market crash: As of 10:37 AM, the Sensex was down 1,064.37 points to 80,225.59, while Nifty was also struggling below 24,300 losing 332.10 points to 24,216.60.
Sensex, Nifty tank in early trade; inflation relief fails to lift market moodThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 540.09 points to 80,749.87, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 160.35 points to 24,388.35.

Mahila Samman Yojana: Key details about Rs 1000 schemeThe AAP government announced Mahila Samman Yojana, offering Rs 1000 monthly to women in Delhi, with a rise to Rs 2100 if it wins in the upcoming elections.

Retail inflation cools to 5.48% in November from 6.21% in OctoberHouseholds across the world's most populous country are likely to welcome the inflation relief, given that food expenses dominate many family budgets.
Sensex, Nifty end lower ahead of inflation data; bearish trend persistsThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 236.18 points to close at 81,289.96, while the Nifty50 was down 93.10 points to end at 24,548.70.
December 15 advance tax deadline: What you need to knowTaxpayers with liabilities exceeding Rs 10,000 are required to make quarterly advance tax payments to avoid penalties and interest charges.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Tabla maestro Zakir Hussain dies at 73 in US hospital, his family confirmsZakir Hussain, the 73-year-old legendary musician, was admitted to a hospital in San Francisco due to heart-related issues.

Devendra Fadnavis-led Maharashtra cabinet expanded, 39 ministers inductedA total of 39 ministers were inducted into the cabinet. Among them, were BJP's Chandrashekhar Bawankule, Pankaja Munde, Nitesh Rane, Shiv Sena (Eknath Shinde)'s Gulabrao Patil, Uday Samant, and NCP (Ajit Pawar)'s Dhananjay Munde and Babasaheb Patil.

IND vs AUS, 3rd Test Day 3 Live: Rain halts play as Rishabh Pant joins Rahul at the creaseIndia (IND) vs Australia (AUS), 3rd Test Day 3 Live Updates and Reactions: Mitchell Starc got Australia off to a perfect start as he dismissed Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shubman Gill in his first two overs to leave the visitors reeling. Josh Hazlewood also got the big scalp of Virat Kohli as he once again exposed his weakness outside off stump. Early lunch has been taken on Day 3 after rain interrupted play for the third time in first session.

Zakir Hussain: The tabla maverick who made the world go 'Wah, ustad'Tabla legend Zakir Hussain, known for his rhythmic brilliance and global musical collaborations, died in a hospital in the US due to heart-related issues.

Isa Guha apologises for Jasprit Bumrah 'primate' comment: 'Chose wrong word'English commentator Isa Guha has apologised for her 'primate' comment on Jasprit Bumrah after the end of Day 2 of the Gabba Test on Sunday, December 15. Bumrah picked up his 2nd 5-wicket haul of the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy series.

Rajya Sabha set for Constitution debate today amid no-trust motion rowIn the midst of a tumultuous parliamentary session, the Rajya Sabha is set to hold a two-day debate on the Constitution against the backdrop of a no-confidence motion filed by opposition MPs against Chairman Jagdeep Dhankhar.

Kohli edged and gone: Fans slam pattern after India star flops in BrisbaneVirat Kohli's dismissal pattern persisted as Josh Hazlewood exploited his weakness outside off-stump in the Gabba Test, raising concerns about the star batter's recurring struggles in the same slot.

Manmohan Singh as PM doomed Congress's return to power: Mani Shankar AiyarMani Shankar Aiyar argued that Congress's decision to retain Manmohan Singh as Prime Minister despite his declining health led to governance paralysis and ultimately doomed the party's chances of forming UPA-III.

Ustad Zakir Hussain, 1951-2024: Life in picsUstad Zakir Hussain, the renowned table maestro, died today, December 15, in the United States due to a heart-related ailment. As the country mourns the loss of the tabla legend, here's a look at his glorious life captured on camera.

AUS vs IND: Jasprit Bumrah completes double milestone with 6 for 76 at GabbaJasprit Bumrah completed a double milestone as he got figures of 6 for 76 against Australia on Day 3 of the ongoing Gabba Test on Monday, December 16. Bumrah continued his fine form in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy with his performance in Brisbane.

'Used my son as ATM': Atul Subhash's father accuses daughter-in-law of tortureThe father of the 34-year-old software engineer, who died by suicide in Bengaluru, has called on Prime Minister Narendra Modi, seeking justice for his son and custody of his grandson.

Supreme Court Collegium summons Allahabad High Court judge over 'majority' remarkThe Supreme Court Collegium has summoned Allahabad High Court Judge Justice Shekhar Kumar Yadav to appear before it and explain his contentious remarks at a VHP event.

Mitchell Marsh takes a stunning catch to dismiss Shubman Gill in GabbaMitchell Starc's fiery spell and Mitchell Marsh's stunning catch to dismiss Shubman Gill put India on the back foot early on Day 3 of the Brisbane Test, as Australia ensured a strong start with the ball after batting heroics.

Why Himanta Biswa Sarma govt is linking Aadhaar with NRC in AssamThe new mandate that Aadhaar aspirants submit their NRC application receipt number aims to curb illegal immigration, thus intertwining identity verification with citizenship debates

Thank you for the joy you brought: Celeb tributes pour in for Zakir HussainRenowned tabla maestro Zakir Hussain, 73, died in San Francisco. Tributes poured in from artists like Zoya Akhtar, Manoj Bajpayee, and Hansal Mehta. He won three Grammy Awards earlier this year.

Deeply concerned: Allu Arjun's message for boy hurt in Pushpa 2 screening stampedeActor Allu Arjun said that he was "deeply concerned" about the boy who was injured in the stampede which took place at Sandhya Theatre in Hyderabad.

Kapil Sharma takes a dig at Atlee's look, Jawan director hits backKapil Sharma took a jibe at director-producer Atlee Kumar's appearance on The Great Indian Kapil Show. However, the filmmaker won everyone's hearts with his classy reply.

Siddaramaiah suggests CBI probe into 'Waqf scam' as BJP denies allegationsKarnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah accused BJP state chief BY Vijayendra of attempting to bribe ex-Minority Commission chairperson Anwar Manippady to suppress a Waqf scam report.

Pro-people, proactive governance key to Viksit Bharat: PM to chief secretariesPrime Minister Narendra Modi emphasised the need for reform, performance, and transformation in governance while urging states to promote citizen participation through Jan Bhagidari.

South Korea to begin President Yoon's impeachment review over martial law: ReportAll six current justices of the Constitutional court will attend the first meeting over the impeachment, which the opposition-led parliament passed on Saturday.

Caught on CCTV: Man flung into air after police vehicle rams him in KanpurA speeding police vehicle in Kanpur, driven by a constable, rammed into a man, injuring him. After the incident, the man's family reached an agreement with the accused cop and did not initiate any legal action against him.

It's endgame for Naxalism in India, says Amit Shah, meets former insurgentsUnion Home Minister Amit Shah reiterated that Naxalism will be eradicated in India by March 2026 under PM Modi's leadership, highlighting significant progress in anti-Naxal operations and reduced casualties.

Shakib Al Hasan given bowling ban in international cricket after ECB callShakib Al Hasan has been banned from bowling in international cricket, the Bangladesh Cricket Board confirmed on Sunday, December 15. The decision comes after Shakib was given a ban for illegal action by the England and Wales Cricket board earlier this month.

Delhi's air quality drops to very poor again, no immediate relief in sightDelhi's air quality level is likely to worsen in coming days amid possible cold wave conditions and dense fog across North India.

Trailing till 88th min, Man United secure dramatic comeback win vs CityManchester Derby: Ruben Amorim's Manchester United secured a dramatic 2-1 comeback win over Manchester City on Sunday, December 15. Trailing till the 88th minute, Bruno Fernandes and Amad Diallo scored in the final moments to hand the visitors a sensational win at the Etihad.

Amorim drops Rashford, Alejandro Garnacho from Manchester DerbyMarcus Rashford and Alejandro Garnacho were dropped from the Manchester United squad in their Derby vs City. Coach Ruben Amorim commented on the snub and stated that he had been paying attention to every single detail.

Watch: Hojlund, Walker involved in heated clash during Manchester DerbyPremier League: Manchester United's Rasmus Hojlund and Manchester City's Kyle Walker were involved in a heated clash during December 15's Manchester Derby. The duo were handed one yellow card each in the first half.

Watch: Minnu Mani takes stunning diving catch vs West Indies in 1st T20IIND-W vs WI-W: Minnu Manu, who was on the ground as Harmanpreet Kaur's substitute, took a stunning catch to dismiss Hayley Matthews in India's first T20I against West Indies on Sunday in Navi Mumbai.

Smriti Mandhana, Jemimah guide India Women to record win in 1st T20IIND-W vs WI-W: Harmanpreet Kaur's India made a stupendous start to their series against the West Indies after winning the opening game by 49 runs on Sunday at the Dr DY Patil Sports Academy in Navi Mumbai.

Rohit Sharma's struggles with bat only matched by confusing captaincy: ChappellIndia captain Rohit Sharma's struggles with the bat in the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy, are only matched by his confusing tactics on the field, said Ian Chappell. Sharma was slammed for his decisions on Day 2 of the Brisbane Test.

Jemimah's fastest fifty powers India Women to historic T20I record IND-W vs WI-W: Jemimah Rodrigues scored 73 runs off 35 balls as India recorded their highest team total against the West Indies. She also put on 81 runs for the second wicket with Smriti Mandhana.

Sourav Ganguly shocked as DC secure superb bargain buys in WPL auctionWPL Auction: Delhi Capitals' Director of Cricket Sourav Ganguly was shocked that the franchise were able to buy youngster Nandini Kashyap for only Rs 10 lakh. Nandini is one of the most promising youngsters in India at the moment.

Sciver-Brunt breaks 26-year-old record, hits fastest Women's Test hundredSA-W vs ENG-W: Nat Sciver-Brunt racked up the fastest Women's Test hundred in the match against South Africa at the Mangaung Oval in Bloemfontein. She broke the record of Sri Lanka's Chamani Seneviratna.

Suryansh Shedge blitzkrieg helps Mumbai win 2nd titleSMAT Final: Mumbai won their second title in the domestic T20 competition by beating Madhya Pradesh in the final. Suryansh Shedge's late heist helped Mumbai trump a heroic knock from RCB's Rajat Patidar.

Jemimah's fastest fifty powers India Women to historic T20I record IND-W vs WI-W: Jemimah Rodrigues scored 73 runs off 35 balls as India recorded their highest team total against the West Indies. She also put on 81 runs for the second wicket with Smriti Mandhana.

Bangladesh pacer Nahid Rana receives maiden call-up for West Indies T20I seriesThe Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) has announced the inclusion of 22-year-old pacer Nahid Rana in the T20I squad for the three-match series against the West Indies. This marks Rana's first call-up in the shortest format of the game.

After 5-wicket haul, Jasprit Bumrah eyes Kapil Dev's historic recordIND vs AUS: Jasprit Bumrah is on the cusp of becoming India's leading wicket-taker in Test cricket on Australian soil. The legendary Kapil Dev currently holds the record with 51 wickets to his name.

India bowlers need to get better with old ball, admits bowling coach Morne MorkelBowling coach Morne Morkel acknowledged that the Indian bowlers failed to execute their plans against Australian centurion Travis Head and urged them to improve their performance with the old ball between overs 50 and 80.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
